creator: flester@gmail.com
text:
hwpf/usermodel/Picture.java has an infinite loop in getting the JPEG height and
width. This patch fixes the loop to not be infinite. The infinite loop is not 
normally triggered, only when the first byte of the image is not as expected.

There doesn't seem to be any patch associated with this bug :(

Any chance you could upload the patch, and also a .doc file that shows up the problem? That way, we can knock up a unit test for this too, and make sure we don't break it again in the future
creator: apache@gagravarr.org

text:
I've updated Picture.java to skip on two bytes at a time, until it finds what it wants. This should avoid the loop.

However, there's no unit test for this, so it might potentially get broken again in the future. So, if you do find a file that triggers this, which you can upload for us to test against, that'd be great!
